title: Drawing, Design for Stained Glass Windows: Chamber Music Hall - Back of Stage, Carnegie Hall, New York, NY, late 19th century
title_raw: Design for Stained Glass Windows: Chamber Music Hall - Back of Stage, Carnegie Hall, New York, NY
medium: brush and wash, gouache, graphite on paper mounted on tan illustration board
inscribed:
recto, in graphite: Chamber Music Hall - / (2 of These)

verso: writing in pen and black obscured by remains of a paper label. Label is stamped in pinkish-red ink: W. L. Colwell, then crossed out repeatedly in graphite.  

Below, in pen and black ink: no. 52
description: Four windows; three rectangular windows of blue and yellow glass with central petals in pink; above central window, a lunette window with similar decoration.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Design for Stained Glass Windows: Chamber Music Hall - Back of Stage, Carnegie Hall, New York, NY, late 19th century. brush and wash, gouache, graphite on paper mounted on tan illustration board. Gift of Alice C. Morse. 2009-6-4-a/d.
